previous: Equivalently, it is eight times the sum of all its divisors which are not divisible by 4, i.e.

The number of representations of a natural number n as the sum of four squares is denoted by r4(n). Jacobi's four-square theorem states that this is eight times the sum of the divisors of n if n is odd and 24 times the sum of the odd divisors of n if n is even (see divisor function), i.e.
after: We may also write this as
where the second term is to be taken as zero if n is not divisible by 4. In particular, for a prime number p we have the explicit formulaÂ r4(p)Â =Â 8(pÂ +Â 1).[10]
